website_summaries.verdict: This grill press is designed to work for outdoor cooking to make your steaks cook evenly every time.
pros: 8-inch length is a nice size for the grill, but still small enough to work well in a skillet
Keeps the splatter down while you are cooking
Smooth wooden handle stays cool while cooking
cons: This model doesn't seem to be as well built as others on the market

customer_reviews.title: nice, fun to have / use
customer_reviews.text: So, I have a GE gas stove with flat griddle middle and I cook sandwiches, steaks, other meat etc on it. This press is nice to keep cooking even or to make a panini. Much better than large can I had been using. Cleans up nicely and looks nice sitting there when not in use.
customer_reviews.author: connie cn

customer_reviews.title: Would not recommend
customer_reviews.text: Poor quality component, would not have bought it if sight seen first. Gave it three stars only because it was relatively inexpensive compared to the others, and in this case one gets what they pay for. Wasn't all that flat, bowed up in the middle, thus the arms were leaning out and the handle didn't fit right, the assembler had difficulty getting the little screws, with only about 1/4" in the wood, to thread and hold. Had two separate holes in each end as the screws never really took a purchase in the wood handle. Pretty disappointed, but will make it work. Get some longer screws and handle it with care.
customer_reviews.author: Erik

customer_reviews.title: Lightweight, Poorly Made Press!
customer_reviews.text: This press is ok but lighter than the description indicates. The description says it weighs 2 1/2 pounds. I weighed mine, on a very accurate scale, and it weighs only 1 pound 10 ounces. Also, it is not flat. If I put this on my griddle, I can spin it like a top. I guess that is not a big problem since it will be sitting on food. It does, however, take a little longer to heat since the whole surface does not contact the griddle. If you are looking for a hefty, well made press, keep looking!

customer_reviews.title: Great press
customer_reviews.text: Great press for bacon and burgers. I did season it even though it came pre seasoned. I removed the handle, heated my grill up to about 800 degrees, and put the press on the grill. Once it was screaming hot, I carefully brushed it with canola oil, let it bake for a few minutes, and repeated several times. After this, I turned the grill off and let it cool down. Once cold, I reinstalled the handle and put it to use. This press is great for about 3 strips of bacon. Any more than that and they stick out the sides. I might also look for a round one to fit my cast iron pan.
customer_reviews.author: Jason

It would be much better with a rod running through the entire handle, end to end, or much longer screws. Other than that it's a decent grill press.

Basically, place your sandwich on a pan, place this on top (don't press, it's sufficiently heavy), grill one side and then turn the sandwich over. Done. Learn a new skill, practise flipping! :)
